meanings.definition: The process of drying up or becoming dry.
meanings.sent1: After the long summer, the exsiccations of the riverbed were evident.
meanings.sent2: The exsiccations of the desert were visible under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent3: The exsiccations of the spilled water made the floor slippery.
meanings.sent4: The exsiccations of the paint on the old wall revealed its true color.
meanings.sent5: The exsiccations of the leaves in autumn painted the ground with hues of red and gold.

meanings.definition: The state of being dried up.
meanings.sent1: The exsiccations of the lake left it barren and lifeless.
meanings.sent2: In the arid region, exsiccations were a common sight.
meanings.sent3: The exsiccations of the fruit made it unappetizing.
meanings.sent4: The exsiccations of the well indicated a severe drought.
meanings.sent5: The exsiccations of the soil made farming a challenge for the villagers.

meanings.definition: The act of removing moisture from something.
meanings.sent1: The exsiccations of the laundry were done under the sun.
meanings.sent2: The exsiccations of the food preserved it for a longer time.
meanings.sent3: The exsiccations of the wet clothes on the line were interrupted by rain.
meanings.sent4: The exsiccations of the wet paint on the canvas required patience.
meanings.sent5: The exsiccations of the wet wood made it suitable for burning in the fireplace.
